Warsaw University of Technology: The Warsaw University of Technology (Polish: Politechnika Warszawska, lit. 'Varsovian Polytechnic') is one of the leading institutes of technology in Poland and one of the largest in Central Europe. It employs 2,453 teaching faculty, with 357 professors (including 145 titular professors).[3] The student body numbers 36,156 (as of 2011), mostly full-time.[3] There are 19 faculties (divisions) covering almost all fields of science and technology. They are in Warsaw, except for one in Płock.
